qas.question: Which group are Ambondro's closely related to?
Which two groups are closely related to therian mammals?
How many years do momotremes and therian mammals go back?
About what year do synapsid date back to?
What is the earliest Ambondro that satisfies Kemp's definitions?
What is Tikitherium more closely related to more than therian mammals?
What time period are fossils of the ambondro dated to in the Middle Jurassic?
About what year are ambondro dated to?
What can the appearance of genera be broadly given?

context: If Mammalia is considered as the crown group, its origin can be roughly dated as the first known appearance of animals more closely related to some extant mammals than to others. Ambondro is more closely related to <a0_0><b5_0>monotremes<b5_0/><a0_0/> than to therian mammals while <a1_0>Amphilestes and Amphitherium<a1_0/> are more closely related to the therians; as fossils of all three genera are dated <b6_0>about <a2_0>167 million years<a2_0/> ago<b6_0/> in the Middle Jurassic, this is a reasonable estimate for the appearance of the crown group. The earliest known synapsid satisfying Kemp's definitions is <b4_0>Tikitherium<b4_0/>, dated <a3_0><b7_0>225 Ma<b7_0/><a3_0/>, so the appearance of mammals in this broader sense can be given <b8_0>this Late Triassic date<b8_0/>. In any case, the temporal range of the group extends to the present day.
